Pedagogy Toolkitfor English
Community-driven resources for digital pedagogy in composition, rhetoric, and literature.

welcome

documentation teaching resources online tools syllabus
Compose course activities with a curated collection of teaching resources.

Explore

documents for lesson and activity planning; resources to help students research, write, and revise; online tools for experiments in digital pedagogy.


Plan your next activity↦

Share

an open source collection of curated teaching material designed to grow. Use resources created by others and contribute your work for others to use.


Share your work↦

Create

template syllabuses and course websites. Go mobile and store your teaching materials in the cloud. All content is open source and built with GitHub Pages.


Take your teaching online↦


Grant funding provided by The Association for Computers and the Humanities (ACH) and the University of Victoria Learning and Teaching Centre. Pedagogy Toolkit is the result of a teaching development project in the English Department at the University of Victoria. This project is developed by Alex Christie with Jekyll and GitHub Pages.
